requirement.title: Launch detection
requirement.description: The plane shall signal a launch if the acceleration is larger than \SI{6}{\meter \per \second^2}.

requirement.title: Velocity estimation
requirement.description: The plane shall estimate the current velocity with a relative error of less than $10\%$.

requirement.title: Velocity control
requirement.description: The plane shall be able to control the velocity such that the relative error between estimated velocity and desired velociy is less than $10\%$ after $\SI{10}{\second}$.

requirement.title: Attitude estimation
requirement.description: The plane shall be able to estimate the current attitude with an error of less than $\SI{5}{\degree}$.

requirement.title: Attitude control
requirement.description: The plane shall be able to control the attitude such that the error between estimated attitude and actual attitude is less than $\SI{10}{\degree}$ after $\SI{10}{\second}$.

requirement.title: Position estimation
requirement.description: The plane shall be able to estimate the current position with an accuracy of $\pm \SI{1}{\meter}$.

requirement.title: Position control
requirement.description: The plane shall be able to fly a path to a position such that the distance between the estimated position and the desired position becomes less than $\SI{1}{\meter}$ TODO TIME.

requirement.title: Altitude estimation
requirement.description: The plane shall be able to estimate the current altitude over ground with an error of less than $\SI{0.2}{\meter}$ while lower than $\SI{20}{\meter}$ and less than $\SI{2}{\meter}$ while higher thant $\SI{20}{\meter}$ above ground.

requirement.title: Altitude control
requirement.description: The plane shall be able to control the current altitude over ground such the error between estimated and desired altitude is less than $\SI{0.5}{\meter}$ TODO TIME.

requirement.title: Mission Execution
requirement.description:
The airplane shall be able to fly a mission consisting of the following states: \begin{enumerate} \item Pre-Takeoff \item Launch \item Loiter \item Waypoint following \item Approach \item Landing \item Mission completion \end{enumerate}
A waypoint consist of latitude, longitude and altitude information and optional heading.

requirement.title: Energy Storage
requirement.description: The airplane has sufficient energy to complete the required distance of 100km.

requirement.title: Debug Channel
requirement.description: The airplane can transmit data if closer than $\SI{200}{\meter}$ to the launch site.

requirement.title: Debug Display
requirement.description: Debug information transmitted by the plane can be displayed to the user.

design-decision.title: Partitioning
design-decision.reason: This partitioning allows to implement the components individually from each other and thus allows to limit the complexity of the mission-critical components.

design-decision.title: Frequency of FCPS control loop
design-decision.description: The FCPS runs all control loops with at least $\SI{10}{\hertz}$.
design-decision.reason: This guarantees sufficient time for all calculations but also guarantees a sufficient controller performance as $\SI{100}{\milli\second}$ is much smaller than all time-constants of the orientation-controlled system.

design-decision.title: Frequency of FCS control loop
design-decision.description: The FCS runs all control loops with at least $\SI{50}{\hertz}$.
design-decision.reason: The motor and servo commands can only be sent at this frequency, thus a faster control loop would not bring any advantages.

design-decision.title: Manual override
design-decision.description: The plane shall be able to be controlled manually while closer than 200m to the pilot.
design-decision.reason: This allows handling errors during launch without risk of crashing.
